text: UPDATED: JUN 18, 2017 Dark roasted, sweet, malty. Lots of chocolate, caramel, vanilla. Very dense and intense. Amazing beer.

Dark roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste with chocolate, coffee, caramel, burnt dark malty nuances, some vanilla, bourbon infused wooden accents into the close.
From tap at Taphouse. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, sweetness, vanilla, bourbon, berries and licorice.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Zwart met een bruine schuimkraag. G: Gedroogd rood fruit, drop en karamel. S: Chocolade, gedroogd fruit, geroosterde mout, cranberries en wat drop. Ook wat alcoholwarmte. Volle body, lichte carbonatie en licht sticky.

Draft @Brouwcafé de Molen. Pours a pitch black beer with a slightly reddish hue around the rim of the glass. Creamy, brownish head on top, settles quickly into a little ring. Aroma of light vinegar and vineous notes, loads of oak, boozy notes, licorice and toffee. Flavor has a nice tarty, red fruit-ish note in there, alongside some nice, sweet caramel and toffee-like characters. Balance is great, aftertaste is long and light vineous and carbonation is medium. Very nice one, even after all these years.
On tap at the Craft Bar in Grayton, FL: Blackish pour, tan head. Dark roasted malts, cocoa, faint soured vibe, coffee, light smoke. Pairs well with spicy Nashville chicken.

EBC 385 EBU 93. Zwart bier en beige/bruin schuim met grote bellen. Geur: alcoholisch, geroosterde mout, koffie en een vleugje rook. Smaak: gebrande noten, koffie, zoet, rode vruchten, druif, sojasaus, sterk alcoholisch. Lichte koolzuurprikkel. Volmondig. Afdronk: zoet, alcoholisch.
0,33l fles van lion gedeeld thanks!. Heerlijk wel zoet met soja trekdrop in de nasmaak ook licht zuur met basalmico. mooi complex

Bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt with coffee and mocha notes. Chocolate finish. Very intensive mocha! Taste: full body with roasted malt and coffee notes. Intensive mocha notes. Superb attenuation. Good chocolate finish. Very intensive beer! Amazing. Aftertaste: chelate and coffee. Sweet roasted malt.

330ml bottle @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, May 16, courtesy of Simon. Many thanks. Pours opaque black, thin beige head. Aroma is lovely rich chocolate cake and bourbon. Taste is vinous with deep dark malts and hedgerow berries. Great stuff.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la brasserie, bouteille #826
couleur noire pas de mousse et pas deffervescence.
Nez sur le vin, le caramel et les tanins.
Attaque acide avec une grosse pointe de tanin continuité sur la vanille et le sherry. Bel équilibre sur la rondeur

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, bottled in April 2015. Pitch black with a thin, frothy, almost stable, light brown head. Sweetish-malty and a little fruity aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, red grapes, dark ripe fruits, some booze and burnt nuts. Sweet, malty and minimally fruity taste of dark chocolate, dark ripe fruits, vanilla, licorice and hints of red grapes, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, minimally warming-alcoholic finish with a touch of tart berries. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, flat. Not the expected flavour bomb, but the barrel notes are perfectly in balance with the base beer. Quite sophisticated, rather easy to drink despite the abv. Very good!

Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Pas loin de la perfection. Nez, palais, texture, corpulence et finale sont exactement ce que jaime. Juste ce quil faut, pas trop comme quelque fois chez De Molen. Equilibre parfait.

Aroma:

Slight aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with roasted malts and coffee.

Lovely balance between oak, whiskey and porter. Has a nice sweetness, making it a bit like port. Slight roasted malts. Lovely!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle at home, thanks to Douberd! Bottled on 2015/04/01 so its exactly one year in the bottle. Black color with nice beige head. Malty aroma, dark dried fruits, wood, vinous, when it gets warmer there are coffee notes, some chocolate, smoked notes too. Sweet, bitter and acidic taste like aroma with smoked wood notes again when it gets warmer. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

What a treat. Pours a rich, brown black with a bubbly, beige head. Big roast aroma, lots of wood, hard alcohol and coffee. Huge flavor, thick and sweet, lots of mocha, burnt brown sugar, roasted malts, peat, scorched earth. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Big warming finish, peat to spare, oak, more mocha and roast. Superb beer

0,33L bottle, no 905, bottled 01.04.2015 (from etre gourmet). Pours black with light brown head the head stays for a moment. Aroma is intense oak, vinous, fruits, raisins, sweetness, roast. Flavor is sour, sweet and bitter, oak, vinous, roast, malt, dark chocolate. Finish is vinous, slightly dry-bitter with some alcohol warmth. Alcohol is very well covered. Overall: more barrel driven than beer driven, but still a great complex sipper.

Robe brune presque noire, mousse peu abondante. Nez sur le chocolat amer, une note lactée, du café au lait, un peu étriqué dans lensemble. Par contre lattaque de bouche est superbe sur un coté moelleux, de la complexité, de la longueur, de la puissance et une finale persistante et crémeuse. Un très grande bière de fin de soirée. A déguster tranquillement.
33cl bottle from etre gourmet. Dark color. Brown head. Medium body. Taste is medium to high sweet. Aroma is chocolate, vinegar, alcohol, wine, herby.

Bottle at home. Pours dark with a tan head. Vinous aroma, caramel, dark fruits, berries, wood, chocolate, alcohol. Taste is moderate sweet, light sour, vinous, dark fruits, caramel, chocolate towards the end as well as in the aftertaste. Quite nice, but not sure if really intended like this.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Not your typical imperial porter. Huge malt flavour. Nice alcohol taste. Pretty smooth texture. Great, overall.

(De Molen Tsarina Esra Reserva) Bottle 330 ml, bottled on April 1st 15. Served into a snifter at home, ABV 11%
Black coloured body, small and thick brown head on top, with good retention.
Aroma has some sour notes, some funk, fruity touches, faint roasted malts.
On the taste the same sour notes can be found, not sure if intented or not, seem to fade a bit aftet the beer has breathed for a while though, cherries, fruity touches, dark roasted malts, coal, well hidden alcohol.
Medium body, sharp carbonation.
Quite good, I must say I expected something richer though.

Un imperial porter qui loue la gloire des tsarines, et surtout dEsra, puisquil va même dans sa 
réserva !! Niveau abv de 11 % pour 23,4° plato, et pas moins de 93 ebu.
Nous avons bien sûr ici la version en barrel aged. Les malts sont en pils, cara, munich et choco.
Il y aussi du froment. Le houblonnage est en premiant et sladek.
Mon exemplaire navait même pas un an, il naurait eu son anniversaire quau 1er avril, alors que 
le brasseur parle dune validité jusquen 2040 !!!!!!! Mais je nai pas pu attendre 25 ans  mea culpa !!
Couleur noir quasi intégral (ebc 385 !!).
Léger voile beige diaphane sur ce breuvage charbon.
Arômes de fût, vin de grand calibre, tanin, pointe de groseilles noires et cassis.
1ère bouche souple au prodigieux ensemble vin/fût/malt.
Arrière-bouche complexe, fine, longue.
2ème grandiose sur bois/tanin/pruneau.
Arrière-bouche inouïe.
3ème à la grande harmonie, digne dun très grand vin.
Arrière-bouche savoureuse à souhait, moelleuse.
Longueur qui est un véritable mémorial au vin, et encore nous parlons des très grands vins du Médoc...
Jambes huileuses (comme lesdits vins .. divins vins).
Levure dense, très élaborée, très grande ligne.
Alcool qui est une pure merveille qui connaît son travail sur les saveurs.
Finale qui est une splendeur des splendeurs .. on va développer dans la conclusion 
CONCLUSION : bière qui est une caverne dAli Baba, dans le plein et bon sens du terme.
Tout y est, et plus si affinités  Mais je me disperse dans les mille et une nuits !!!
Mea culpa, mea esra, mea maxima Esra !!!  Alléluia, et sois bénie, ma tsarine, au firmament 
dAli Baba réserva où tu recevras un 500 sur 100, dans 25 ans ...
Tasting at Maakuns. Bottle shared by Mrk. Enorm lekker zacht mondgevoel, dik als yoghurt, zwart stropie, drop, hout, met een zuurtje. olieiig als een mofo. Backlog from 2015/10/16.

33cl bottle. No. 59! Pours opaque black colour with a mid-sized brown head. Aroma of dark roasted malt, red fruits, wood, coffee, alcohol. Taste of dark roasted malt, red fruits, wood, sweet chocolate, warm alcohol finish.

Bottle, pours reddish black with small off white heaD. Notes of brisket, fig, dates, dark fruit, and toffee. Mollases and sticky burgundy barrels. Medium bodied with slight stickiness. Dirty butt and Hersheys finish. Thittt

500eme bière - Bouteille achetée chez Erzbierschof - 2010 version bottle Number 0578 aged in my cellar- De couleur noir avec une fine mousse fauve - Au nez des arômes de chocolat, de cacao, de fruits rouge, de figue, un peu terreux, un nez très envoûtant - En bouche des arômes de cacao, de chocolat, terreux, herbacée, une pointe dalcool - Corp puissant, amertume moyenne/forte, carbonation correcte pour une veille bière, amère et soyeuse et douce , longue final chocolat amère - Délicieuse, lâge arondi les houblons et fais ressortir la douceur du malt PA version non âgée était beaucoup plus punchi mais moin équilibrée

Dark brown pour, close to black, with a very thin lacing. Smells a bit like the base beer, dark fruit, roasted malts and sour cherries, with an addition of vanilla and hints of whiskey. Tastes like sour cherries, roasted malts, some vanilla, caramel and some kind of strong liquor, like apple brandy. The downside is that the mouthfeel feels much lighter than it should, and it also feels much carbonated than would feel nice.

Bottle at home, bought at Bierhalle Deconinck.Black with a light beige head. Sweet chocoolate, red wine and tanniines kicking in as it opens up. Taste is full, red & dark fruits, chocolate, more red wine. Very easy drinkable, one of the better dark beers Ive had in a while.

A "hordóérlelt De Molen" szóösszetétel az én olvasatomban csaknem a tökéletesség szinonimája, már ami a söröket illeti, s ha az ember egy olyan üveget tart a kezében, amelynek szavatossági ideje lejártát a 2040. évben határozza meg a gyártó, azt is biztosra vehetjük, hogy a falak között szunnyadó ital megérdemli a különleges bánásmódot. Valójában csak kitartás kérdése, mely életszakaszában kívánjuk összeismertetni magunkat a 11,9%-os imperial porterrel, én azonban kissé kiábrándító módon már újszülött korában felkerestem a csodafőzetet. Tényleg nagy baklövés ez a részemről, mivel már az illatából is sugárzik a hosszan eltarthatóság jellege, szinte ordít az érlelésért, kissé elébe menve a dolgoknak elmondhatom, hogy minden egyes porcikája a szebb kor megérésére hivatott. Türelmetlenségemnek hála tehát már a gyártás évében letesztelhettem, s legyen bármennyire is fiatal az ital, összességében lehengerelt a karaktere. Sötétlő színe közepesnek tetsző textúrát csillant meg, már ha a kategória mértékegységét vesszük alapul, habja keskeny és fahéjszínű, aromái pedig bámulatosan teltek. Sülthúsos fűszeresség, hamus füstösség, orvosságos keserűség, édes és sós jegyek vad kavalkádja, ahol a kiemelkedő komponensek a forró csokoládé, túlérett meggy, bőr és vanília, sós karamell képében jelennek meg. Szirupos, lényegében szénsavtartalom nélküli textúra, sziporkázó savanykásság, füsttel kevert, befőttes édesség és nagy formátumú, kanalazhatóan testes ízjegyek. Utánozhatatlanul tartalmas ital, szinte elképzelhetetlen, mit hozna ki belőle még pár évtized.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Really dark brown pour with a thin layer of brown foam. You definitely get some barrel character in the aroma but also an astringent note. Taste starts with dark malts and some caramel and gets quite tart in the middle. It has a sour cheery note along the roasted malt. Lingers bitter in the aftertaste with the same astringent note. Body is medium-heavy with soft carbonation. Overall its a good beer but not that well put together. Without the astringency it would have been much better.
Pours black with light beige head. Balsamic vinegar, roasted, licorice and roasted. Flavour is roasted, vinegar, licorice, medium to heavy sweet and light bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 Bottle shared at home. Black with short lasting big beige head. Lots of yoghurt on the nose. Sweet chocolate, bourbon, light spices, yoghurt, red wine, sweet dried red fruits, light espresso. Medium sweet with a light tart touch and soft bitter finish. Full bodied with slick feel and fitting low carbonation. Quite nice, but the yoghurt notes dont work for me.

May 29, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2009. 
Black with a small frothy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, hints of chocolate and coffee, wet wood, dark fruits, dried fruits, port and cardboard. Taste is medium sweet, soft roasted bitterness. Finish is sweet with plum, raisins, toffee, red berries cardboard, soft roasted bitterness with some chocolate notes. Medium bodied, slightly creamy texture, almost flat.  
A bit too old with clear signs of oxidation.
8-4-8-415=39


October 15, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled april 1, 2015. 
Black with a small, lasting, dense dark tan head. Aroma is vinous with an overtone of wet oak, some red berries, hints of roasted malts and chocolate.
Taste is light sweet, vinous, slightly tart with cherries, hints of oaky tannins and light to medium roasted bitterness. Finish is medium sweet with berries and dried fruits, red wine, hints of gooseberries, some roasted notes of coffee and chocolate and light sour. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, somewhat creamy texture. 
A bit too much wet wood and sour notes in a porter for my liking...
7-4-7-4-15=37



Get the impression that the 2009 was a better base beer but has suffered from aging.

Negro opaco y espuma beis ligera. Aromas intensos de frutos negros, manzana oxidada, madera, licor. Cuerpo denso, sabor dulce, manzana roja, frutos negros, ligera acidez y final seco de madera con amargor tostado moderado. Trago cálido.

330 ml bottle #1451, bottled 01-04-2015, from Etre Gourmet.
Black body, with a small, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma is pretty vinous, with a lot of oak, also dried fruits, cocoa, coffee.
Taste starts also with vinous and oak notes, then merges into dried fruits, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, coffee, tobacco, subtle liquorice.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, quite dry, with oak, wine, cocoa, tobacco, some coffee.

Interesting. The typical Porter notes are just in the background, dominated by vinous barrel notes. I would prefer more equality of both elements, on the other hand the vinous notes provide an unusual freshness for this style. Overall not my favourite kind of a Porter, but tasty nonetheless.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en Belmonte _puertas 14-09-2015. De el Sr. Don lupulo (r285) Botella n 614 elaborada en 01-04-2015 hasta 01-04-2040th. Color negro intenso con espuma también oscura. Aromas y sabores suaves y finos de maltas algo dulces, tostadas y ligeramente quemadas con toques de cacao y especias con maderas empapados en licor. Cuerpo medio con...vol y buena sensación alcohólica. Líquida fina y algo espumos a. Bastante buena, para repetir sin duda.

deep dark brown, almost black colour, moderate sized, creamy, though not too stable beige head; aroma of coffee, chocolate dried plum and cherry, woody as well as some liqueur notes; taste of chocolate, dried plum, syrupy sweetness, some mild roasted coffee, herbal notes, tobbacco, hints of vanilla, liqueur and  spicy alcoholic aftertaste; amazing beer
Bottle. Black colour with tan head. Roasted, dark chocolate, wood and wine aroma. Roasted, dark chocolate, sweet, wood, wine taste. Medium to full body.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate retentive tan head. Aromas of dark berry jam, black coffee grounds, chicory, dark molasses, and oak. Flavors of acidic black coffee, coconuts, vinous green oak and tobacco. Oddly somewhat sour. Still a good beer.

33cl bottle thanks to k0mpsa. Superb winey nose with lots of aromas like fermented veggies. Really rich and multidimensional palate. Just interesting and brilliant. Maybe there should be more balance.
Bottle from bierkoning, amsterdam. Black color, brown head. Aroma has barrels, oak, coffee, roasty. Nice roasty taste, coffee, oaky notes, chocolate.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, vinous, dried fruit, and chocolate - with a roasted finish.

Jan 2015 Bottle thanks to my summer secret Santa. Aromas are cherry cola, vinegar, raisins, tobacco, and light chocolate. Tastes sorta sour but not much. Seems to be on purpose but almost tastes like a minor infection. Lots of cherry cola and raisins, other dark fruit and chocolate too. Good but was hoping for more.

12 oz bottle thanks to AdamC. Much thanks! Deep black color, good amount of carbonation. Ok... Hold on, Porter-ish? Stout-ish? IPA- ISH? Sour infected grain, red wine vinegar, moldy oak. 
Great another infected Brew bottled and sold. Totally not cool. This is an infected beer that the brewer somehow still bottled in sold. Reminds me of the De Molen brew I had right before this. Well, if people still buy it... Why not? Glad I didnt spend money on this. Thanks Adam???
Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler dark brown pour with a tan head. Aromas of malt caramel chocolate and ash. Taste is sweet fruit alcohol and smoke.
12oz bottle shared by AdamChandler. Thanks, Adam! Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, smoke. Flavor is dark chocolate, mild smoke.

Pours dark brown, a very small head. Aroma is smokey, a bit tart, sweet watermelon and kiwi and pineapple. Decent mouthfeel, a little thin, some wine barrel taste, grape, fruits, a lot of roasted qualities, a little smokey. Good beer overall.

330ml bottle at home. Bottle No 157, Bottled 04/2015, BB 04/2040. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells wood, malty sweetness, liqueurish, dried fruits, raisins, some berry notes, earthy notes. full body, soft carbonation, full mouthfeel. tastes wood, sweetness, bourbon, some dried fruits, some citric notes, bitter chocolate, some spices, earthy notes again, a bit astringent. finishes with some wood, citric notes and earthy notes. Overall very good beer, but I m not totally satiesfired. Overall I liked this one a bit better than the normal version. But it feels quite heavy and it does not drink so easy for me. Definitly not my favorite De Molen beer.

Bottle at home while visiting Amsterdam. Pours a dark brown/black. Aroma is ash and coca cola. Medium body, medium carbonation. Lovely sweet and sour mix, lemon, candy, nice salty thing... Good stuff.
Cest nettement moins bon que loriginal ... "parfois, le mieux est lennemi du bien" ! Des arômes vineux un peu piquant, un peu instable ...

Flesje gekocht @Bierkoning. Een zwart bier met minimale schuimkraag. De geur is duidelijk anders dan de reguliere Imp. Porter: door de zoet-bittere geur een duidelijke zurige boventoon. De smaak is zurig, zoet en bitter met het karakter van een whiskey/cognac. Een complexe afdronk. Het bier is minder subtiel dan de normal Tsarina, maar zeker interessant om te drinken en van te genieten.

33cl bottle at home from de Molen, Bodegraven. Body is pitch black, head is very small, brownish, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Nose is alcohol, cherry, roasty, flavor is whiskey, chocolate, bonbon, cherry, slightly smoky, vanilla, toffee. Medium sweet, heavy roasty bitter, light sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty bitter, chocolate, light sweet-sour, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, nearly flat carbonation. Great dessert beer, a bit heavy, tasty, complex aroma, interesting.

Bottle at Stuus. Pours black with a tight tan head. Aromas of high alcohols, wood, apple brandy, soy. Taste has some heat, more soy, liquorice, tar. Light roast notes come through. Still boozy on the finish, in a nice, warming way.
Bottle at home, says barrel aged on the label. Pours black, nose is chocolate, wood, hint of soy, boozy, taste is sweet, soy sauce, chocolate, hints of apple.

Post-studying celebration beer. 330ml bottle #168, 11%, bottled April 2015. Black, small foamy tan head when forced, bit of a fizz to it. Aroma is astringently woody, coffee-ish, raspberry. Body is medium, smooth, touch of carbonation. Taste is fruity oak, tangy red berry, light coffee, ash. Quite sharp and astringent to start, but got smoother and more chocolately over time. Slow drinking. Carbonation and tanginess had me questioning whether this was flawed, but nice anyway.

batch van 2015 #843, ondoorzichtig, zwart en minimale bruine kraag. aroma van mouten, zoet, chocolade, gebrande en geroosterde mouten, whisky, zacht, gebalanceerd. Smaken zijn matig zoet, matig bitter, zeer sterke smaken, donker fruit van pruim, vanille, bourbon, stevig alcoholisch, in het begin zelfs wat teveel aceton tonen erin maar dat kan komen omdat het bier even moet ademen en opwarmen want later was dit een stuk minder, verder koffie, chocolade, laurier, jout, medium body, prima te drinken echter vond ik de eerdere imperial porters en stouts eigenlijk qua niveau wat beter.

Nip size bottle courtesy of Hackobock. Thank you! Pours pitch black with a small ring och mocha head that doesnät leave much trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malty with roasted malts, dark bread, caramel, charred wood, rasins, dried cherries, moist soil, vanilla, dark roast coffee, cocoa powder, soy sauce, cardboard, alcohol and minerals. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and slightly boozy. Mouthfeel is soft, tiny flat, round, oily, slightly roasted astringent, boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, raisins, prunes, coffee, cocoa, alcohol, cardboard, minerals and soy sauce. Fairly oxidized and most likely best a few years ago but still holds up well enough. Tasty...

Bottle. Black pour, small brown head. Aroma of fruity booze, cherry and chocolate. Taste has cherry, milk chocolate, almond, vanilla, cognac like booze and a warming finish. Very good, fantastic beer.

330 ml bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a beige head, good retention. The nose is full of mellow coffe and mocca, milk chocolate, and some earthy alcoholic touch that is typical for the last couple of BA batches with De Molen, and that I am not so found of. Vanilla and cognac notes. Medium body, thick sweet start, fading into an alcoholic and roasty end. Taste is chocolate milk and bourbon alcohol. Except for the litte off-aroma, this is a very pretty beer.

330 ml bottle poured into a wine glass. The beer is a thick black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma reminds me a lot of creme brûlée. Caramel and chocolate sweetness with a bit of spice. I actually think it is pumpkin spice, but that has to be wrong. Fairly sweet taste, and quite good. Thick mouthfeel and low carbonation. Very good beer.

Bottle at home, numbered 735, bottled April 15. 9th May 15. Pours black, reasonable head for a imperial porter. Aroma is slightly vineous, some barrel, dark chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is rich and delicious, smooth elegant barrel, prune dates, chocolate, vanilla, oak and wood. Quite decadent and even royal as the name suggests!

shared bottle with a friend, new batch from 2015, poured a pitch black colour with a small beige head. roasted malts, cacao, dark sweet chocolate, vanilla, some fudge, oak, bourbon sweetness, ash, bit of smoke in there aswell. full mouthfeel
Bottle at a big tasting (Nördprovning 2015). Malty smell with dried fruit and raisins. Similar taste. Very complex with lots of flavour, but not all over the place. Well rounded.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 A very interesting beer. The colour is beautiful, the nose is wonderful, full of chocolate and raspberry. Its a strong beer but well balanced. My only issue is I found it too sweet for my taste.

Bottled. Pours pitch black, opaque with a little, creamy and tan head leaving some good lacings. Aroma of roasted malts with smokey notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry. Full bodied, creamy texture and flat to soft carbonation. An excellent brew.

Bottle brought over by Ben on the great Prague excursion. 25cl number much like the one in the picture. Pours Black with a dissipating Tan coloured head. A massive beer with customary roasty chocolate notes. Soaked in alcohol and with an extremely well measured dose of wood. A bit of vanilla. Thick, rich and satisfying. Delicious.
From old tasting notes - Near black with flat head. Sweet woody vanilla fruity aroma. Roasty fruity chocolate and vanilla. Soft carbo. Excellent.
Bottle. Black with tan head that fades. Aroma of licorice, chocolate, wood, boozy lliqueurs. Taste of roasty chocolate, molasses and wood. Thick and sweet. Nice

Bottle 18cl, nice label. Looks good. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Heavy malty aroma. Starts strong, a bit alcoholic, more and more malty-earthy, notes of coffee and bitter chocolate. Finish warming-malty. Good one!

Bottle 0.18l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Bottled 2009. Nro: #957. Colour is black with very small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, hints of chocolate and roasted malts. Aging pretty good.

Small 2009 bottle #690. Thanks Steve! Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and fruit. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, coffee, and wood. Very nice to sip on.

Little bottle, #550, huge thanks to Fonefan! Pours opaque black, medium super creamy tan head, sloooooowwww dissipating, leaving nice lacing. Aroma is rich and chocolate, roasted malted, cigarettes, bourbon. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet, bit of anise, chocolate, tobacco, light bitterness, oak. A bit sharp. Pretty full body, creamy mouthfeel. Some abc burn. Interesting beer.

My 5700th rating! [Bottle (250ml? Anyway, its a little guy) c/o Glouglouburp. Vintage 2009, No. 834.] Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a spare bubbly off-white head. Wonderful aroma of roasted malt, soya sauce, alcohol, dark fruit, coffee, vinous notes, hops, salt, some caramelization and more -- lots going on here. Flavours just as good, and surprisingly fruity and hoppy, along with soya sauce, chocolate, some red wine and again, much more. Alcohol is pretty much hidden. Average bodied. This is a gem, 4 years old and totally delicious.
Pours a pitch black beer with a tan head. Smells chocolate, cake and something. Tastes chocolate, coffee bit vanilla and a nice bitter finish. Medium body, sticky texture and an average carbo. Great!

25cl bottle, #903, brewed 19.02.09. pitch black, brown, thin head. Licorice, plums, coffee, light medicinal notes. Flavors are coffee, licorice, dark fruits. Quite soft, light mouthfeel. Long plummy finish. Well, nice sipper, but not top notch.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Dark brown, a lot of beige foam. Low carbonation. Complex and well balanced beer. Sweet aroma of candy sugar, honey and dark fruit. Some roastiness and bitter finish. Good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.09.2013, 0,18l bottle (#679/1216, 2009 vintage) @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is very balanced and rich, dark malts, licorice, chocolate, coffee, toffee, oak, vanilla, alcohol, some spices, hints of chili. Taste is mild and balanced, dark malts, oak, licorice, alcohol, dark sugar, coffee, even more licorice, cocoa, caramel, grass, vanilla. Longlasting mild bitterness, little carbonation, kind of a "thin" body because of the carbonation level. Still very nice!

Bottle: Vintage 2009: #943/1216: To the 100 years excistence of PSV: Served in a wine glass:
A darker brown pour. A lively (light) brown foamy head, that seems to change into a lacing quick on top of a black colored beer.
Aromas of bourbon, vinous, nettle, roasted barley malts, hint of liquorice, vanilla, marzepin and cream.
The flavour is a gentle smooth mix of vanilla, spices, cream, roasted malts, bread, vinous, some liquor notes, a hint of marzepin, raisin, some marshmellows, bitters, creamy porridge and some creamy grainy notes.
Aftertaste is a mix of roast, bourbon, cream, light vinous, leaves, some malt, hay roast and vanilla.
Low carbo, soft creamy silky mouthfeel, full body and an oily texture.
This one is indeed the best of them all. Delicious! Was worth the time waiting for this one!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
2009 Vintage 2/16/2011: Tsarina Esra Reserva... Aroma: Milk chocolate and roasted malt; just a bit of vanilla sugar and caramel. Appearance: Near black, opaque; mocha-colored crown. Flavor: Dark chocolate, vanilla, dark malts, and a bit of alcohol; dry, dusty at times in the middle; almost milky, coffee-like finish. Palate: Medium body; calm and smooth; good mouthfeel. Overall: VERY good!
330 ml bottle (11% Alc; O.G. 1108; F.G. 1026) shared by alexsdad06. Thanks Tom! Rating #242 for this beer.

Bottle. 11.0%. Bottle no. 219. Best before Feb. 34. Pours dark brown, almost black, with a small khaki head. Bit of lacing. Tart aroma, a wee bit roasted, dark fruit notes and a bit oxidised. Remote salty note. Coffee, chocolate and sweet liquorice deep down. Flavour is sweet and tart, dark fruit and oxidised notes, bordering vermouth. Light perfume note as it warms. Bitter, tart, wine/vermouth finish with a lingering dry note. Overall good, but a bit too tart. 31.07.13.

Rich opaque brown pour with one finger of chestnut tan head. rich nose, malt forward with notes of burnt sugar, blackstrap molasses, raisin/fig, bitter chocolate.  Lots of molasses and bitter chocolate in the flavor with notes of acidic coffee and burnt sugar, prune, and dark fruit.  Full bodied with a moderate bitterness and acidity.

tasted side by side with the cognac version, this was a 2009 vintage, and 77ships drank it blind ( i knew what was what ) 

pours black, small white foam 
this ones a lot thicker, , intenser, and sweeter. this would almopst be woth going for ! but still, hel en verdoemenis beats the shit out of it !

Thx! to Kraddel for this one. 2009 Vintage, 18 cl. red wax, old school previous brewery De Molen. Bottle nr. 662/1216. Dark brown, almost no head. Thick hazelnuts, syrup, chocolate milk, sweet, cake, muffin, almost touch of nose booze, Taste is bit affected by age, touch oxidation, licorice, herbs, cake, spices, coffee, herbal, thick cacao powder, Bit thinner body. Better than the new stuff but unfortunately once a big fan boy I am truly beginning to hate this brewery.

Tap at Queen's Head, Stockholm. Nose is chocolate, heather and honey. Mouth is very smooth and creamy with loads of honey, heather, tones of chocolate and vanilla. Sublime.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at GBBF 2011.Late rating due to misplaced tasting book.Dark brown to black pour with minimal head.Sweet boozy aromas and some oak.Tastes of chocolate,alcohol,caramel,coffee and a little butterscotch and oak.Had 2 samples of this one as a member of our group didnt like it,great stuff,i certainly did.Very nice.

Green bottle, dipped in wax, 25 cl, brewed on February 19 200, bottled on October 8 2008, best before 2036, savoured on December 29 2012; eye: black, opaque, tiny ring of dark brown head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, molasses, dark candied fruits, anise, milk chocolate; mouth: roasted barley, molasses, dark candied fruits, anise, black coffee, light alcohol, whisky, light burnt barley, light sourness, finale in roasted barley with presence of candied dark fruits, medium-full body, not much carbonation, a bit thin; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, trempée dans de la cire, 25 cl, brassée le 19 février 2009, embouteillée le 8 octobre 2009, meilleure avant 2036, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 29 décembre 2012; il : noire, opaque, petit anneau de mousse brun foncé, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, mélasse, fruits noirs confits, anis, chocolat au lait; bouche : orge torréfiée, mélasse, fruits noirs confits, anis, café noir, léger alcool, whisky, léger orge brûlée, léger aigrelet, finale en orge torréfiée avec présence de fruits noirs confits, corps moyen-corsée, peu carbonatée, un peu mince; en résumé : bien

Thx to Koelschtrinker for this one ! 
2009 vintage 
Head: Very firm, dark cappucino head, about half inch thick 
Colour: Dark brown - Black 
Smell: small amount of roast, pretty sweet on the nose and some caramelised malts, and some candy, quite high on the booze and that also gives some sweetness like oaky / vanilla, and most important , lots of dark chocolate !! 
Taste: start is lots of black high cacao percent chocolate, then some booze ( but less than i expected ) with small amounts of coffee, some butterscotch and caramel, end is a fine calvados and rum flavour, aftertatse is red port wine , very very nice !!

A-- NO piff, no sound when opening. Ah, no carbonation. Wonderful. Poured dark cola color. A few bubbles here and there and a small circle of lacing for film. Brings back bad memories of a flat Black Damnation I got from them. 

S-- Still has a nose so we press on. Lots of sweet malts. Kind of a root beer smell. Also get touches of oak as well. Soft nose and no ABV smell. 

T-- Candied char, ash and burnt rubber. For the love of Mikkeller. Quite thin. But it lacks carbonation you say. I am totally not impressed. 

M-- Thin, obviously lacking carbonation, sweet and has a finish of the usual char, ash and tires. At least Mikkeller gets carbonation right. 

O-- Drinkable for not carbonated. I keep telling me I am drinking a sherry from the Netherlands. Might be a decent port. Paid $11 for a 180 ML not carbonated RIS. Next time label this as a port. Brutal.

Cannot believe I havent rated this, I consumed a lot of it at previous GBBFs. Rating from memory. Cask at Great British Beer Festival 2010 & 2011, Earls Court, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a slight head. Sweet and boozy aroma. Tastes of dark fruit, sweet, rich and boozy. Surprised it wasnt at last weeks GBBF 2012.
Pours a deep dark brown. Infected, hints of metal chocolate and coffee. Moderate carbonation.

Courtesy of HenrikSoegaardbrewed 19.02.2009, bottled 08.10.2009Black color, with medium sized creamy head. It has a moderate aroma of roasted malt, light acidity, very light leather. Full bodied, with round mouthfeel; good flavor of roasted malt and some dark chocolate; little residual sweetness; there is a light note of leather and acidity; the bitterness is very low.Too old, it probably didnt age very well; just a quite good beer.

Bottle thanks to Scott! Pours black with a small dark chocolate head that starts and remains at the edges. Aroma has a good amount of dark grains and bitter chocolate with an alcohol backing. Flavor has a bitter chocolate note with hints of coffee backed by dark grains, roasted malts and a bit of alcohol.

Nip bottle, 2009 vintage, Bottle #205.  Poured medium-deep brown with a dense, swirly dark tan head.  The aroma picked up very sweet, sticky whiskey and vanilla over warm chocolates and a hit of treacle.. overall very sweet, with very little alcohol present.  The flavor found burnt coffee and licorice plus lesser chocolates at the core.. bright, peaty whiskey and sharp husky bitterness throughout.. finished with a shot of whiskey and some vanilla over burnt coffee roast.  Heavy-bodied with low carbonation on the palate.. just a tad too sharp and bitter at times.. overall a solid brew, but not quite what I was hoping for.

Bottle, 18cl. A murky, dark brown beer topped by a small, tan head. Roasted aroma with some caramel and dried fruits. Some coffee and a bourbon-like vanilla and oak touch. The flavor is lightly sweet, its full-bodied, warming and smooth on the palate, with the additional flavors of roasted malts, caramel, coffee and some dried fruits. Quite vinous. Long roasted finish. A vinous and pleasant beer. 111014
saw this at Pikku hiding in the corner, ending a long quest... super balanced porter, chocolate with a bit of ash, super drinkable

[bottle--thanks, fonefan!]
Coffee and chocolate fudge brownie aroma with some liquorice and peppermint. Viscous black appearance under a nice light brown blanket that recedes to a tight ring. Sweet pumpernickel and sour dark chocolate flavour in balance with a subtle bitterness, finishing with sweet cereal-y chocolate. Full body, but not cloyingly sweet, moderate to low carbonation, sweet, slightly nutty finish.

180ml bottle, red wax neck bottle, deep black color, with a frothy bubbly tan head, mild phenolic alcoolic, yeasty, fruity nose of burnt dried raisins, figs, dates and with a mild plum juice, brownie note, and a good roasted, chocolate, dark, toasted malt, minty chocolatey, faint raisin pie, date square, chocolate syrup accent in the aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a warmth juicy plummy, raisiny, yeasty fruity, chocolatey, coffeeish, dark bitter chococlate, burnt fruitcake character with some raisn glossette, light chocolate cake, roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malt flavours, with a faint minty chocolate bar, chocoalte syrup, raisin pie backbone, leading towards a warming yeasty fruity, chocolatey, juicy plummy, roasty bitterness finish.

Bottle 180 ml [2009]. Appearance: Pours pitch black with a medium brown head. Aroma: Wood, smoke, roasted malt and caramel. Taste: Porto, vanilla, wood, smoke and roasted malt. Palate is vinous and dry. Overall: A really good porter with De Molen signature. Porto taste is somewhat surprising in this kind of beer.

Bottle 180ml. [Bottled Feb 2009, n.826]
Pours black, with low beige head, nice lacing. Aroma is of smoke, caramel, alchool, oak, roasted malt. Taste is alchool (porto-like), caramel, roasted malt. Very complex, lots of flavors involved. Interesting complexity of the aroma, taste is heavy, difficult to describe with accuracy. Very porto-like.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is alcohol, coffee, roasted malt,hop, peat. Flavour is alcohol, peat, coffee,  roasted malt, hop. Full body. Very nice beer.

18 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu. Rated on 08.04.2011
Aroma has lots of vanilla, some roasted malts, coffee and hints of chocolate. Flavour has vanilla, coffee, some cocoa and hints of licorice. Very good, although all the malt and make this a bit too sticky and sweet towards the end of the glass.

250 ml bottle; wow, thanks Brandon for this long time want!! pours dense black with slight white head; chocolate is heavy on the nose with light bourbon, dry malt and chocolate; molasses, charred malt, chocolate, dry malt; creamy mouthfeel, almost a meaty feel to it; super smooth and tasty chocolate overall; yum

Pours a thin, coffe like black with a ring of creamy lacing.  Nose is weird, spirit barrel-like, pretty barrel forward without all the wacky charred ashy qualities of these one-off De Molens.  Liqeuor-like mouth, sweet with strange vinous qualities, grappa-like.  Light coffee tones coming through the plethora of mixed berries.  Finish is a bit odd.  All in all one of the better De Molen medicine bottles.
Black with a lasting light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and very bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Smooth and oily. 140212
gbbf 2010. I cant remember the ins and outs of this one, however I do remember a good amount of caramel and coffee notes. An absolute belter of a porter.

25 cl bottle courtesy of daknole.  Pours dark brown with a small tan head.  The aroma had big roasted malts,chocolate, dark fruits, raisin, hints of spice and some alcohol.  The flavor had more big roasted malt and dark chocolate, wood, dark fruits and some alcohol heat.  Medium bodied and quite tasty.

250, capped and waxed in red, bottle #313. Thanks, Rene! Pours black and still with a loose, thin rim of dark tan around the edge. Big soy sauce nose, showing overripe dark pitted tree fruits, alcohol, chocolate, and a little bit of leather. Sticky body on the high side of medium, but not overbearingly thick. Not very carbonated. Chocolate, dark fruits, some soy, and a vodka twang on the mid palate. Fairly cohesive finish; could have gone all to soy sauce but actually winds up pleasantly.

Bought at Brouwerij de Molen.  Bottle number 641.  Recommended by the owner.  He does know his products. Caramel, chocolate, black, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a thin dark brown head. The aroma has notes of soy sauce, roasted malt, fruits, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of vanilla, roasted malt, alcohol, soy sauce, and caramel, leading to a dry, roasted, and alcoholic finish.

Bottle from my 2011 Secret Santa. Thanks! Bottle 881, 2009 vintage. Pours very dark brown with a thin creamy tan head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of rich dark malts, rich chocolate, smoky wood notes and a hoppy finish. The taste is dark roasted malts, wood, cherries, chocolate and a hoppy finish. Medium-full bodied.

Nip bottle @ home, a very generous bonus courtesy of pushkinwow. I fucked up and sent my package to him late and he still bonused out the wazoo. Thanks a bunch mi amigo! Very deep brown/black appearance with a small tan head with big bubbles. Super rich, roasty, chocolate malty, oaky, roasty coffee, burnt malty, lightly smoky, slightly charred aroma. Rich, chocolate malty, quite roasty, dark coffee, rich chocolate icing, woody, even a touch fruity, charred, anise flavor with a warming, a touch boozy, rich chocolate dessert finish. Rich chocolate aftertaste. Cool beer!

180mL nip thanks to Glouglouburp.  Very fruity and complex nose.  Lots of dark fruits, maple syrup, some woody and red wine notes, vanilla, quite figgy. Not very porter like.  Blackish pour with a small tan head and adequate lace.  Flavor is quite vinous and lightly tart on the tongue at first, further sipping reveals more dark fruits, some slightly overcooked brownies in the finish amidst light bitterness and some sweeter oxidation-like flavors.  The alcohol is pretty well hidden when drinking but I can now feel the heat coming on as a sit and type.  An interesting beer and, doesnt really fit the style in any way, but thats okay with me.

180 ml bottle on the train to RBNAG-11. Dark brown, almost black body with a thin beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit, caramel and pleasant alcohol. Flavor is sweet dark malt, roast, bitterness, mild peat and smooth perfumed whisky. Fine body, well composed, fine warming alcohol. Pleasant sipper.

In short: Chocolate cake with red grapes in a bottle.  Very good.
How: Tiny 180ml bottle.  According to the bottling date consumed when 1.5 year of age
The look: Black body topped by a long-lasting small beige head
In long: Nose is quite fruity (a lot more fruity than the regular Tsarina Esra) with vinous notes over a chocolate cake.  Taste follows through.  This is like a chocolate cake with red-grapes.  Not sure what to add to this simple description, maybe notes of Sherry.  Its not even vinous, just plain red grapes.  Well levelled medium carbonation.  11% remains mostly well hidden.  I had the regular Tsarina Esra side-by-side with this Reserva version and honestly I didnt notice much resemblance.  Bit those little 180ml bottles of special De Molen beers are just too expensive, so expensive they are Im suspecting they put computer printer ink in them.

Bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of chocolate, peat, roasted malt, caramel and coffee. Flavor is sweet and warming with some roasted and chocolate malt. Full body, average carbonation.

Nutty dark chocolate and a nice fruity hop back on the nose. Dark brown pour, thin bubbly ring. Chocolate, roast, earth, nice bitter hops, almost fruity hop undertones and a nice bitterness to finish. Really nioce smooth stuff. Fuck yeah.

Bottle thanks to Papsoe. Pours a very dark brown with bronze tinges down the side of the glass. Smallish creamy dense coloured head. Falls away pretty quickly leaving no lacing. Big aromas of dark bitter chocoltae, espresso cofee, sweet dark fruits and port like alcohol. Good stuff. Flavours are sweet, sour and bitter all at the same time. Slightly harsh alcohol on the finish. Oily medium to thin mouthfeel. Flavours dont quite live up to the aroma but bloody good all the same. Thanks papsoe.

Cask at GBBF 2011, Day 3. What a treat. Pours a rich, brown black with a bubbly, beige head. Big roast aroma, lots of wood, hard alcohol and coffee. Huge flavor, thick and sweet, lots of mocha, burnt brown sugar, roasted malts, peat, scorched earth. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Big warming finish, peat to spare, oak, more mocha and roast. Superb beer.

18 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu.
Pours pitch black colour with no head. Aroma is licorice, light tire, dark malts, coffee, caramel and some soy. Flavour of dark malts, light chocolate, caramel, coffee, toffee, notes of soy and some mocha. Surprisingly balanced brew with such high alcohol content. Nice.
4325

Pour is medium dark, relatively small quickly dissipating head. Aroma is cream, caramel cinnamon and salt water taffy. Taste is coffee, caramel, some salt. Very subtle. Not too sweet, very easy to drink, great to sip on.

180mL nip thanks to Glouglouburp. Rating #200 for this rarity. Thank you Dany. WAWA!!! The pour is a deep mahogany with quite a healthy tan head. Creamy and rich mousse like. Webby lace. Nose is quite muted actually- tough to coax out the soft cinnamon, rose pedals, dry wood. Molasses and brown sugar is there with small cedar. Very subtle though. As it warms, you can coax out more complexity in the nose. Sharp, tangy booziness comes through from the Bordeaux and buttery chocolate. Creme brulee and raspberries. Exquisite, but one of the most stubborn aromas to get at. Very hard to coax out of the glass. Taste is woody, a little bit tart actually creating instead of a dense, sweet, and heavy chocolate body one more of lemon sorbet, roses, and cinnamon. Finishes a bit thin with woody dryness. As it warms, the palate gets a little richer with some silky almost butteriness. Fluffy, sponge cake palate. Almost aerated in profile. Very easy to love and relatively simple, but really lacking the power and intensity of Hel & Verdoemenis and their other heavy hitting imperial stouts. I guess I was expecting something really in your face but this is about as soft and subtle as they can be.

Cask at GBBF 2011, 3rd day. 
Black, slight head. Boozy, winy aroma of chocolate. Woody, roasty, hot flavor, milk and berries. Lots of booze, portlike and thin.

Poured from a wood cask at GBBF 2011 by the man himself, Menno. It pours opaque black, with a thin, dark tan head. The nose is liquorice, caramel, toffee, rich-roast coffee, dark cherry, wood, smoke, bourbon, molasses and alcohol. The taste is wood polish, liquorice, roasted malt, coffee, meaty, alcohol warmth, earth, salted caramel and bitter chocolate, with a rich roasty finish. Full bodied, sticky mouth-feel and low carbonation. Very well balanced, complex and delicious.
Bottle @ home, bought at De Molen. Slow drinker, but nice. Fine aftertaste with light hops. Low body though for this high ABV.

From cask at the Great British Beer Festival 2011.  Black, with almost no head.  Smells sweet, alcoholic and chocolatey, rich.  Tastes strong and sweet, and of chocolate/coffee.  Certainly something to it, but not Rochefort.

Cask/gravity at GBBF 2011. Black and oily pour with a narrow clingy head, wine and liquorice on the nose, along with hints of whisky and treacle. Body is rich and almost syrupy, yet dry-bitter rather than cloying. Amazing stuff.

Bottle sent generously by Glouglouburp and shared with friends, thanks Dany! Pours dark brown with a mocha head. Smells of sweet malt, wood/oak, and booze. Taste is dark roasted caramel malt with a dry, woody finish. A bit sweet initially and mid-taste, but good.

15/07/2011 18 cl bottle #0839 @ Klaas &Tims collaboration stout tasting - bottled: 14/01/2010 (2011-337) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Very dark brown beer, red glare, no head, small beige rim. Aroma: citrus fruits, strawberries and other forest fruits, cherry pie, jam, black currant lemonade. MF: little carbon, full body, syrupy texture. Taste: fruity, sweet, candi sugar, some fruity hops then a more bitter hop flavour. Aftertaste: red fruits, fruity hops, some peaches, more strawberries. Amazing how fruity this one is! Loved it.

Bottle at Haandverkerstuene. 
Totally black, low tanned head.
Spicy aroma with coffee, fruits, chocolate.
Taste of wood, fruits, coffee, pepper. 
A lovely beer.

180ml bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki
Bottle #439, bottled 9.10.2009
Pours pitch black with a nice bubbly beige head. Aroma has hints of oak, coffee and malts. Taste is quite salty with notes of roasted malts, caramel, toffee and oak. Full bodied, long lasting finish. Well balanced.

180 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu, Helsinki.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beige foamy head on the edges. Aroma of oak, whisky, roasted malts and some syrup. Flavour of roasted malts, oak, raspberries, syrup, oak and some hops. Full bodied with a sticky mouthfeel and a warming, syrupy, fruity finish with oak. Very pleasant, better than the non-reserva version.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a huge dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light rounded notes of scotch with light roasted malt with well balanced sweet undertones. Taste is a great mix between light roasted malt with sweetness notes and some subtle notes of scotch. Body has a nice creamy texture with well rounded body with great carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very well brewed with nice level of complexity and no apparent alcohol.

18cl, red-waxed bottle, #1035/1216 courtesy of madmitch76. thanks, ken! pours a dark, cola brown with a smooth, creamy, beige head that has great retention and leaves silky drips of lace. aroma is wonderful with rich notes of chocolate brownies, brown sugar, and sweet mocha espresso backed by dark fruits, vanilla, and subtle bourbon with just a hint of roast and earthy spices. flavor is fantastic as well with rich, vinous dark fruits, spicy bourbon, oak, and rich toffee backed by roasted malts, bittersweet chocolate, coffee, and cigar ash with hints of soil and bitter molasses on the finish. palate is smooth and damn near creamy with dense carbonation and a dry, lingering, roasted finish. overall, a world class imperial porter.
murky mud colored, large bubbled light beige ring. Earthy ash nose, light bit anise. Flavor similar, burnt chocolate with lingering ash, light paper bitterness. Thin, inky body, short finish.
Verhalten süßer Antrunk, sehr würzig und stark malzig. Deutlich herb, harmonisch süß-hopfig. Vollmundig, malziger und fast gleichartig süß-hopfiger Abgang, etwas holzig. /13/11/12//12

0,18 cl bottle from de Molen. Pours pitch black with a small light brown head leaving some lacing. Aroma is fruity, heavily roasted malts, smokey and chocolate on front. Coffee and slightly vinous aromas on back. Fullbodied velvety smoked mouthfeel. Peaty, smokey, very roasted, alcohol and fruity sweet very well balanced flavor. Palate is so good, slightly pungeant and so velvety. Finishes with a longlived fruity and very tart aftertaste with some sweetness.
Bottle. Black with tiny beige head. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bitter, little vanilla and liquorice.

0.18 L red waxed bottle, #487 of 1320, brought home from de Bierkoning, Amsterdam.  A tall big-bubbled choco head, resting on a ruby edged, near black body. Nice and complex smell of rounded dark malts, creamed caramel,  dark dried fruits and milk-chocolate. A whiff of alcohol, and some subtle barrel notes.  Taste is dark malty and heavily bitter-sweet, yet rounded with a vinous character. Notes of alcohol-soaked dark fruits, vanilla and chocolate. Prickling, champagne-like carbonation. Full-bodied. Warming alcohol in the finish. Fully balanced with great complexity. Awesome!

180ml bottle #850 from IPB. Botled Oct 2009..
Appearance : Black with small head that is short lived. No lacing.

Aroma : Sweet spirit alcohol. Nice fruity notes with light vanilla. "Liquoreux". Light hops. Notes of wood. Light licorice. Lots of stuff. Light floral notes. Light booze.

Taste : Bourbon and light booze. Perfumy notes. Great chocolate. Light bitterness on the finish with a light alcohol kick. Rather dry. Vinous notes too maybe. Something odd on the finish that I cant put my finger on. Floral notes on finish.

Overall : Interesting one. Very rich and complex. Nice nose. Lots of barrel but still interesting. Complex taste with quite a lot of barrel. Nice chocolate. Only thing Im not sure about is the odd floral or pot pourri that I get on the finish. Lengthy finish with nice dark chocolate and wood. Alcohol is quite well hidden. Overall nice complex drink. Lots of barrel but well integrated. Great sweetness on finish but never cloying. Think Im getting used to the finish. Great sipper.

250ml bottle feb 2009. Pours a jet black, at first no head or lacing but a nice creamy tan lacing appears. Nice aroma - smells of bourbon, sherry, alcohol, some fruit and a hint of chocolate. Very smooth, great carbonation, slightly sweet but the alcohol really bites - this one shows promise but I am hoping it becomes more balanced with age.

Pours dark black with thin to no head, aroma has notes of dark chocolate, dark fruit, roast. and some bourbon.  Taste is notes of malt, dark roast, with touch of dark chocolate, some dark fruit and roast, nice bitter finish.  great balance of bitter and chocolate.  Delicious.

Bottle shared by tyler.  Thanks!  Very slightly hazy dark pour, with no real head, and only slight lacing.  Aroma is big roast, slightly boozy character, nice.  Taste is slightly roasty, with nice chocolate and coffee character.  Quite nice.  Finishes fairly dry, with a bit of booze.  Nice.

Bottle shared by Tyler!  Clear dark brown pour, very little carbonation and a strong boozy raisin nose.  Flavor is slightly oxidized prunes then starts strolling into burnt smokey malt, nuts and finishes slightly oaky, dry and slightly campfire-like on the finish.  I really like this one.

180mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany), pours black with a tiny tan head. Liqueurs dominate the nose, with brandy and sherry notes upfront, followed by deeply roasted malt and potent hops - quite the abrasive aroma. Flavour is massive - the mentioned liqueurs begin, making way for dark roast notes, which immediately give way to potent hop notes - creating a hoppy liqueur-like finish. Everything meshes together really well here. Most superb.

Bottle at Max and Jesss housewarming. Hazy brown pour with some tan head. Aroma is of vanilla, oak, some wine, and fruit aroma. Flavor is sweet with dark fruit, roasted malt, light vanilla and chocolate and oaky tones.

Micro-bouteille de 18cl. Capsule de métal recouverte de cire. Batch 987. Bière brune foncée avec des reflets rouges presque sans mousse. Le nez cette bière vieillie en fût de chêne est vineuse, une touche aigre est perceptible avec des effluves de chocolat. Les goûts sont vineux, comme le présentait le nez, elle est boisée sans donnée limpression vanillé.  La finale chocolatée est bien agréable. Une belle petite bouteille.

(Courtoisie de JulienHuxley)   Le liquide présente une robe brune très foncée entourée dune fine lumière rouge.  Le col mousseux est mince et fugace.  Au nez, des parfums torréfiés se choquent à des souffles chocolatés habilement touchés par le raisin et lenfûtage.  Très intéressant.  Le goût est bien peu éloigné des arômes.  Je dirais même très représentatif : les grains rôtis donnent du café et du chocolat amer et le vieillissement permet de belles notes vineuses dans lesquelles les saveurs du raisin sont bien vivantes.  En bouche, le corps me semble bien construit, justement texturé avec une effervescence modérément active.  En finale, des notes chocolatées douces et chaudes rencontrent des notes légèrement piquantes de vin rouge.  En résumé, bonne bouteille.

Bottle. Very dark brown, very small and fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate malty and sweetish aroma, roasted malt and coffee, some sourness. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, lots of roasted malt and some coffee, piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish, roastiness and coffee, lots of piney hoppyness, some alcohol. IS with lots of coffee. Aroma and flavor/finish are not in balance.

My Bottom Line:
Dark chocolate, coffee and red wine intertwine from aroma to sensuous finish in this elegant and cohesive Barrel-Aged Imperial Porter. 

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the brown-edged darkness.
-The soft carbonation is appropriate for the suave body. This is not a heavy Impy at all, this is rather elegant.
-The chocolatey finish is lovely.
-The flavor profile is perhaps linear, but it is pleasurable and harmonious.
-Subtle alcohol warming tags along the intelligent barrel presence.
-Malt flavors are ably developed; this is far from a sugar bomb.

Bottle.

Bottle at Max and Jesss place.  Pours a deep brown to black with ruby highlights under a thin beige to white head.  Chocolate, big roast, vanilla and alcohol, but very subtle and delicate.  Big and roasty, chocolate, honey, and more roast.  Long roast with some wood and tannins on the finish.

Bottle at Maxs tasting.  The aroma is gorgeous, booze, dark chocolate, coffee, roasty.  The appearance is deep brown, tan head.  The flavor is booze, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, licorice.  The finish is alcohol warming, piney hops.  Medium/thick in body.  Beautiful.

Bottle at Maxs tasting. Roasted malty aroma, with caramel, oak, and some almost sherry like sweetness. The flavor has roasted malts, oak, vanilla, dark fruits, a hint of chocolate, and some light tart-ish notes. Nice.
Bottle at Maxs tasting. Pours black. Tan head. Nose/taste of barrel, toasted chocolate malts, milk chocolate, toasted coffee beans and vanilla. Light lacto sweetness in the chocolate.

Bottle Pitch black ale with a small, creamy, khaki head. The nose offers charcoal and singed roots and herbs. Full-bodied with a skim-milk mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor is both sweet and tangy and presents notes of dark chocolate and alcohol. Finishes rich and caramely with a splash of mildly acidic red wine. Bottle courtesy of Plovmand!

(Bottled) Almost black with a smallish, firm and beige head. Milky-sour, lightly roasty nose with coffeeish maltiness, vanilla and a touch of licorice. Intense, sweetish-malty flavor with salty licorice, vanilla, and yet quite generous hop bitterness. Warming mouthfeel and fill body with low CO2. A very well balanced, intensive brew.

Thanks to fonefan for this 25cl bottle. 

THis dark pour has nice flavors of dark chocolate, black cherries and vanilla and finishes with a touch of sweetness.

Bottle courtesy of hopscotch.  I was diggin this imperial porter.  That being said, can we put it in a bottle for men??  Black pour with roasted malt and bitter chocolate aromas.  The taste was well balanced with roasted malt, vanilla, and some dark fruit flavors.  Well done...
A bottle pulled out of Mikedashgs "drinking" frige.  Soy sauce brown to almost black.  Big sharp roasty sweetness.  Pungent sour hiding way down deep in the back. Light mouthfeel.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured dark reddish brown color with an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted malt, dark fruit and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark fruit sweet flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to moderate to long duration. Solid complex beer.

Amazingly powerful, complex aroma of fine espresso, bakers chocolate, cedar, cherry liqueur, and Chinese Five Spice.  The taste is off dry, and echoes the same, but is not quite as overwhelming or mouth-filling as the aroma would suggest.  Light sherry and cedar notes on the finish.  Virtually no indication of the high ABV.  World class.  Reminds me, a little, of a fine Bordeaux or Chateauneuf du Pape in the wine world.

Bottle courtesy of my secret santa -- thank you for the generosity!  Shared in a vertical with the base beer.  Pours oily black with a beige head.  Nice carbonation.  Smells and tastes of date juice, tannins, toasted marshmallows, and vanilla.  A fine beer, but doesnt quite do justice to the standard.

(Bottle #1037, 0.18 l, at Pikkulintu) The beer poured almost black and it was quite clear. Its head was medium sized and light brown. Aroma had roastedness, vineousness and vanilla. Palate was full bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were roastedness, vineousness, vanilla, wood, malts and mildly bitterness. Aftertaste was woody and roasty. I found this beer nice. Wood, vineousness and the almost burnt roastedness were pleasantly balanced.

Dark coloured beer with almost no (beige) head. coffee, caramel odours. Thick liquid, with sweet bitter taste. Aroma same as odour but more strength to the burned malt. Sorry I stop writing this review, tasting the beer en enjoying it is much better

Pours a dark brown with à small head. The aroma is punchy with red berries dark chocolate, ash, and a hint of bourbon oak. The flavor has chocolate strawberries, black berries, oak, bourbon, vanilla, ash and a minerally finish. Stellar brew.11%...92 IBU? Wow.

Pours a dark brown color with very little head. Dried fruit, raisins, port, sherry, brown sugar aroma. Flavor is rich and sweet with some prunes, raisins, caramel, honey and chocolate. Nice beer.

Nip bottle. Pitch black pour, some brown head. Aroma is extremely woody, very stuffy bourbon/chocolate notes. Taste is mild in comparison to the aroma, mellow chocolaty and boozy with some dry wood notes. Palate is medium to full bodied, with light carbonation. A very nice beer.

Nip bottle.  Shared by Beerbill.  Pours a nearly flat (very slight carb- with a miniscule thin head) oily deep dark thick amber brown.
